benchmark_details.name: SUQL (Structured and Unstructured Query Language)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents the first conversational agent that supports the full generality of hybrid data access for large knowledge corpora through the Structured and Unstructured Query Language (SUQL). It introduces a semantic parser capable of handling hybrid data sources and demonstrates the effectiveness of the approach on the HybridQA dataset, achieving strong performance in combining structured data queries and free-text retrieval techniques.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a formal query language (SUQL) that can combine structured data queries and free-text retrieval for conversational agents.

data.source: Crowd-sourced questions and conversations from Yelp datasets.
data.size: 1828 restaurant entries with reviews and dishes.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the retrieved results against ground truth from the HybridQA dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher exact match and F1 score indicate better performance of the conversational agent.
methodology.baseline_results: Within 8.9% exact match and 7.1% F1 of the SOTA model in HybridQA.
methodology.validation: Validation through comparisons with existing benchmarks in the HybridQA dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data will be available under the Apache License, Version 2.0.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Crowdsourcing processes included user consent for research purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Data collection procedures have been approved by an IRB.
